content.heading: HTML Text Formatting
paragraphs: HTML contains several elements for defining text with special meanings.

content.heading: HTML Formatting Elements
paragraphs: Formatting elements display special types of text:

content.heading: HTML <b> and <strong> Elements
paragraphs: The <b> element defines bold text without extra importance.
The <strong> element defines strong importance, typically displayed in bold.

content.heading: HTML <i> and <em> Elements
paragraphs: The <i> element defines text in an alternate voice or mood, typically displayed in italic.
The <em> element defines emphasized text, typically displayed in italic.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
Example:
<small>
This is some smaller text.
</small>

content.heading: HTML <mark> Element
paragraphs: The <mark> element defines text that should be marked or highlighted.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
Example:

Do not forget to buy milk today.

content.heading: HTML <del> and <ins> Elements
paragraphs: The <del> element defines text that has been deleted from a document, usually shown with a strikethrough.
The <ins> element defines text that has been inserted into a document, usually shown underlined.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
Example:

My favorite color is blue red.

Example:

My favorite color is blue red.

content.heading: HTML <sub> Element
paragraphs: The <sub> element defines subscript text, used for chemical formulas.

content.heading: HTML <sup> Element
paragraphs: The <sup> element defines superscript text, used for footnotes.
